content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on a horizontal surface is attached to a horizontal spring of negligible mass and spring constant <math alttext="50 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall, and there is negligible friction between the block and the horizontal surface. When the spring is unstretched, the block is located at <math alttext="x equals 0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The block is then pulled to <math alttext="x equals 0.3 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and released from rest so that the block-spring system oscillates between <math alttext="x equals negative 0.3 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace></mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 0.3 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the magnitude of the acceleration of the block and the direction of the net force exerted on the block when it is located at <math alttext="x equals 0.3 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: Magnitude of Acceleration Direction of Net Force <math alttext="30 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> Positive

Magnitude of Acceleration Direction of Net Force <math alttext="30 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> Negative

Magnitude of Acceleration Direction of Net Force <math alttext="0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>m</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Positive

Magnitude of Acceleration Direction of Net Force <math alttext="0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>m</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Negative

content.answer: Magnitude of Acceleration Direction of Net Force <math alttext="30 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> Negative

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
